content: 2018 Singaporean film ***Republic of Food*** is a 2018 Singaporean dystopian [comedy-drama film](/wiki/Comedy-drama_film) directed by [Kelvin Tong](/wiki/Kelvin_Tong), starring [Adrian Pang](/wiki/Adrian_Pang), [Yeo Yann Yann](/wiki/Yeo_Yann_Yann), [Jeffrey Xu](/wiki/Jeffrey_Xu), [Patricia Mok](/wiki/Patricia_Mok), Shane Mardjuki, Alexandra Tan, [Bobby Tonelli](/wiki/Bobby_Tonelli) and [KF Seetoh](/wiki/KF_Seetoh). Supported by the [Ministry of Communications and Information](/wiki/Ministry_of_Communications_and_Information) (MCI), the film was released at selected [Cathay Cineplexes](/wiki/Cathay_Cineplexes) cinemas on 16 August 2018. The film was subsequently re-edited into a six-episode web series and is available for streaming on [Viddsee](/wiki/Viddsee). ## Synopsis In the near future where a virus has forced a global ban on the consumption of all food products, a television host named Chia Kau Peng joins the Underground Food Club (UFC) which comprises a group of people who desire the taste of food cooked using real ingredients. ## Cast - [Adrian Pang](/wiki/Adrian_Pang) as Chia Kau Peng - [Yeo Yann Yann](/wiki/Yeo_Yann_Yann) as Virginia Goh - [Jeffrey Xu](/wiki/Jeffrey_Xu) as Zhang Yimao - [Patricia Mok](/wiki/Patricia_Mok) as Meimei - Shane Mardjuki as Haris - Alexandra Tan as Xiao Ling - [Bobby Tonelli](/wiki/Bobby_Tonelli) as Rad Ruben - [KF Seetoh](/wiki/KF_Seetoh) as Zito Seetoh - [Oon Shu An](/wiki/Oon_Shu_An) as Miss Mo - [Patrick Teoh](/wiki/Patrick_Teoh) as Old Chia - Silvarajoo Prakasam as Mr. Rajan - Regina Lim as Yimao's girlfriend - *Republic of Food* at [IMDb](/wiki/IMDb_(identifier)) This article related to a Singaporean film is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e This article about a 2010s comedy-drama film is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Republic of Food
